definition: to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Professor McGonagall blew her nose in reply.
sentences.chinese: 麦康娜教授抽动了一下鼻子算是回应。

sentences.english: Hattie whipped the ends of her braids against my cheek.
sentences.chinese: 海蒂抽动辫梢打我的脸颊。

sentences.english: To compare with the side effect of the Chinese medicine-"Choudongling Granule" and that of western medicine - Tiapride.
sentences.chinese: 中药抽动停冲剂与西药硫酸泰必利副作用的比较。

sentences.english: The twitch of his tail can break a man's leg like a matchstick .
sentences.chinese: 牠抽动尾巴可以像折断火柴棍似的打断一个人的腿。

sentences.english: She may twitch her tail or even lash it from side to side.
sentences.chinese: 她也许是抽动尾巴，甚至将尾巴摆来摆去。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the clinical characteristic of children's tic disorder.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨儿童抽动障碍的临床特点。

sentences.english: The child's mouth twitched as if she were about to cry.
sentences.chinese: 这小孩的嘴抽动着，像是要哭。

sentences.english: The flat refusal made Dursley's chins quiver, but after a moment he persisted.
sentences.chinese: 直白的拒绝让德思礼的下巴抽动起来。

sentences.english: Thrusting is most characteristic of adult mating behavior.
sentences.chinese: 抽动，是最具特征的成年交配行为。

sentences.english: The snake's tongue flicked from side to side as it prepared to bite .
sentences.chinese: 蛇在准备咬东西时，舌头左右飞快地抽动。

sentences.english: Moments later her back arched, and her arms and legs began thrashing wildly.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，她的背拱起，胳膊和腿开始剧烈抽动。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate whether genomic imprinting is involved in the etiology of tic disorder.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究遗传印迹是否与抽动障碍的遗传病因学有关。

sentences.english: Objective:To explore the effect of parental rearing patterns on tic disorders in children.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨父母亲的教育方式对抽动障碍儿童的影响。

sentences.english: The cat's nose twitched as it saw the fish.
sentences.chinese: 看到鱼，猫的鼻子抽动起来。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss the curative effect of EEG biofeedback treatment to child tic disorder.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨脑电生物反馈治疗儿童抽动障碍的疗效。

sentences.english: An older name, nocturnal myoclonus, is rarely used anymore.
sentences.chinese: 它的旧名字夜间肌肉抽动已经很少使用了。

definition: to shake (a part of one's body)/to shrug (shoulders)/to create a sensation/to incite
to open and close (the mouth etc)
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
